intro: Oldenlandia corymbosa var. erecta, commonly known as the upright mistletoe, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is a hemiparasitic shrub that grows primarily in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has small, opposite leaves and produces clusters of small, white or pinkish flowers. Its fruits are small berries that contain seeds dispersed by birds. This variant is distinguished by its upright growth habit compared to other varieties of Oldenlandia corymbosa.
